channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0224; 04:45AM; 11256 N Paso Robles Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JeUCFc; #GranadaHills; Firefighters arrived to find a two-story home with fire showing from the second floor. Crews ascended ladders to the roof to vertically ventilate the structure, while other companies deployed hose lines for an interior fire attack. It took 36 firefighters 13 minutes from the time of alarm to extinguish the flames. One adult male patient was found with burn injuries, who was treated and transported to a local hospital by LAFD paramedics. The cause of the fire is under investigation. ; FS 18; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC12 BC15 E18 E275 E287 E75 E8 E87 EM15 RA18 RA75 RA87 SO1 T75 T87; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Structure Fire, Auto Aid COUNTY 04/08/2024 INC#1138

item.description: Structure Fire, Auto Aid COUNTY; INC#1138; 03:30PM; 23222 W Ida Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3VOvlJy; outside city; 2 story SFD w/heavy fire. 2 Task Forces from LAFD responding. CMD: 10, Tac-U68/U-66.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District outside city; BC15 BC17 CM42 E107 E296 E305 T105 T96; CMD10; U66, U68; David Ortiz

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1462; 08:48PM; 801 W 106th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TQpVLv; #VermontVista; First arriving firefighter report detached garage fully involved with possible exposures. Firefighters were offensive mode utilizing fire attack handlines to extinguish fire in the non-converted garage. Fire companies are checking exposure for fire extension. Rapid firefighting tactics allowed 34 firefighters to get a knockdown in 21 minutes preventing horizontal and vertical spread of fire. LAFD resources will remain on scene to provide salvage and overhaul to ensure full extinguishment of fire. ; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC11 BC13 E233 E264 E33 E64 E65 RA264 RA64 RA864 T33 T64; CH9; 12; Mark McLean

Structure Fire; INC#1462; 08:48PM; 801 W 106th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3TQpVLv; Vermont Vista; First arriving firefighter report detached garage fully involved with exposures. Firefighters are operating in offensive mode.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC11 BC13 E233 E264 E33 E64 E65 RA264 RA64 RA864 T33 T64; CH9; 12; Mark McLean

Update Jumper; INC#1135; 05:22PM; 454 N Mission Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xvF3qk; Boyle Heights; Firefighters are on scene working with LAPD to assist with a man on a pillar approximately 20' above ground level. During the process to do a technical rescue and get rescue air cushion in place patient fell to ground below. Patient is being transported to Regional trauma center in unknown medical condition via Los Angeles City Fire Department Paramedic Rescue. No fire personnel injuries. LAFD Resources will remain on scene for extensive equipment cleanup. Unknown duration. Metrorail has shutdown tracks eastside of LA river. Railroad Police have shutdown tracks on westside of LA river. Both Tracks will open up for normal traffic when all LAFD personnel are clear. LAPD Inc #498/2957; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E1 E2 E20 E201 E202 E203 E220 E3 E4 EM1 HR3 RA2 RA3 T1 T2 T20 T3 UR3; CH7; 13; Mark McLean

Jumper; INC#1135; 05:22PM; 454 N Mission Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xvF3qk; Boyle Heights; Firefighters are on scene working with LAPD to assist with a man on a pillar approximately 20' above ground level. Firefighters are attempting to set up a rescue air cushion for rescue purpose. Metrorail has been notified to shutdown tracks below the pillar. LAFD USAR companies are enroute to assist for a technical rescue if needed. LAPD Inc #498/2957; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E2 E20 E203 E220 E4 EM1 RA2 T20 T3; CH7; 13; Mark McLean

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0857; 02:13PM; 6081 W Cashio St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JeroGo; #Mid-City; Initial arriving firefighters found several trees on fire exposing a Two-story duplex structure. Firefighters quickly extinguished the trees. Firefighters worked in offensive mode utilizing fire attack hose lines with vertical ventilation to keeping the fire from spreading vertically or horizontally in the four different exposed two-story structures. 36 firefighters took 52 minutes to extinguish flames in all exposed structures. LAFD resources will remain on scene for a unknown duration performing salvage and overhaul. LADWP notified for down power lines. No reported injuries. No further details. ; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC18 CM20 CM22 E261 E292 E294 E43 E61 E68 RA68 RA892 SO1 T61 T92 T94; CH9; 12; Mark McLean

Update Structure Fire; INC#0857; 02:13PM; 6081 W Cashio St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JeroGo; #Mid-City; Initial arriving firefighters found several trees exposing a Two-story duplex structure. Firefighters knockdown and extinguished the trees. Firefighters are in offensive mode utilizing fire attack hose lines with vertical ventilation to quickly keeping the fire from spreading vertically or horizontally in the exposed structures. Possible multiple structures exposed with fire. No further details. ; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC18 CM20 CM22 E261 E292 E294 E43 E61 E68 RA68 RA892 SO1 T61 T92 T94; CH9; 12; Mark McLean

Structure Fire; INC#0857; 02:13PM; 6081 W Cashio St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3JeroGo; Mid-City; Initial arriving firefighters report several trees exposing a Two-story duplex structure. ; FS 58; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC18 E261 E292 E294 E43 E61 E68 RA68 RA892 T61 T92 T94; CH9; 12; Mark McLean

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0776; 01:18PM; 2511 S San Pedro St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3U8w5rS; #HistoricSouth-Central; Initial arriving firefighters found One-Story commercial doing business as Burger King with heavy smoke showing. Firefighters utilized fire attack hose lines with vertical ventilation to quickly extinguished the flames and keeping the fire from spreading vertically or horizontally. It took 36 firefighters 16 minutes to extinguish the flames and achieve a knockdown. LAFD resources will remain on scene to insure complete extinguishment. LACO Health department notified. The cause and origin is currently under investigation. No reported injuries.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC11 BC13 E15 E17 E201 E21 E215 RA15 RA17 RA21 SQ21 T1 T15; CH9; 13; Mark McLean
